input_text:
Job Title: Site Engineer

Location: Madison, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Fantastic Opportunity for a Project Engineer to learn from the best of the best in the Construction space!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Kelly Anne Wight

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $60,000 - $85,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are partnered with a top General Contractor who has a phenomenal reputation in the Wisconsin market, as well as nationally. They are on the search for someone who still wants to grow with a firm. You will use your expertise to secure work with current and new clients. The company has been in business over 100 years with a very strong pipeline of commercial work. They are looking to expand their construction team as part of their growth plan by hiring a Site Engineer to take on some key responsibilities.

Why join us?

 Base salary of $60k - $85k dependent on experience Performance based bonus  Health Benefits 401k Match Maternity and Paternity Leave 3+ weeks PTO Retirement Savings Plan Telecommuting and flexible working Career development opportunities Additional Perks

Job Details

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field. Previous experience in project engineering, site engineering, RFI's, and punch lists preferred. Strong understanding of construction methods, materials, and legal regulations. Proficiency in project management software and MS Office Suite. Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently as well as part of a team. Willingness to be onsite regularly and adapt to varying field conditions. Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.

If you are a dedicated, ambitious, and innovative professional who enjoys working in a team-oriented environment, we would love to hear from you. Join us and contribute to some of the most exciting construction projects in the industry.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
